revised_title: Quantifying the Effects of Neutron and X-ray Radiation on the Small Intestine Using a Mathematical Model
tldr: This study investigates the effects of neutron and X-ray radiation on the small intestine using a mathematical model. The researchers found that different cell types in the small intestine have varying responses to radiation, and they developed a Morphological Index to quantify the structural damage caused by radiation. The results can potentially be used to predict tissue damage and inform treatment decisions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology and Histology
